7.content:
{
  "events_table": [
    { "min_roll": 1, "max_roll": 3, "event": "Accused Ally", "description": "One of your allies (GM's choice) is implicated in a terrible crime. A character with a Law Guild Licence can spend an Endeavour to free the ally with a successful Average (+20) Lore (Law) test. Otherwise, 3 Endeavours spent by the party will exonerate their ally (or, if guilty, manufacture an alibi). If the ally is freed, gain a Major Favour for future use. If not, their ally hangs!" },
    { "min_roll": 4, "max_roll": 6, "event": "Arcane Auction", "description": "The belongings of a recently deceased neighbour are auctioned, including a dusty, old book of unknown origin. If you are able to pay the 10 GC asking price, the book is yours! Beyond any other advantage the book may bring as determined by the GM, any Academic characters attempting the Research Lore Endeavour gains +20 on the Test." },
    { "min_roll": 7, "max_roll": 10, "event": "Betrayed!", "description": "A friend, family member, or ally turns on you, the ramifications of which will impact your next adventure. If you have no friends, family, or allies, your time between adventures is blissfully uneventful though somewhat dull." },
    { "min_roll": 11, "max_roll": 14, "event": "Bolt from the Blue", "description": "A lazy ostler didn't lock the stable door, and your mount bolted! If you succeed at an Average (+20) Animal Training (Horse) Test, your well-trained beast returns to the hand that feeds it. If you fail, your steed is gone, unlikely to be ever seen again. If you don't have a mount, you have developed a painful new blister on your foot." },
    { "min_roll": 15, "max_roll": 18, "event": "Oi! You spilled my pint!", "description": "A petty argument in the local area has developed into a feud – the GM decides who you offended and how. This person will not pass up an opportunity for petty revenge, probably during the next adventure..." },
    { "min_roll": 19, "max_roll": 21, "event": "Crime Crackdown", "description": "The Watch is cracking down on crime hard. Rogues can get no funds from the Income Endeavour, and if Rogues undertake a Banking Endeavour, they may only select a High-risk deposit, as legitimate banking houses won't handle dirty money." },
    { "min_roll": 22, "max_roll": 25, "event": "The Exciseman Cometh", "description": "An unexpected visit by the tax collector (with several soldiers in tow) sweeps through your local settlement. All characters lose 30% of their funds before any can be spent on Endeavours." },
    { "min_roll": 26, "max_roll": 29, "event": "False Silver", "description": "To the horror of the merchants, a run of counterfeit coins plagues the characters' locale. A fifth of all coins are affected. Characters who undertake the Banking Endeavour will lose 20% of money banked, and characters undertaking the Income Endeavour similarly reduce any money earned by 20%." },
    { "min_roll": 30, "max_roll": 33, "event": "Flowing Profit", "description": "Business is particularly good for folk involved in river trade. All Riverfolk make an additional 50% from any Income Endeavour pursued during the next batch of Endeavours." },
    { "min_roll": 34, "max_roll": 36, "event": "Forewarned is Forearmed", "description": "You are given a cryptic omen by a dream, Strigany mystic, or Celestial wizard you encounter on the street. During your next adventure, your maximum Fortune points are increased by 1." },
    { "min_roll": 37, "max_roll": 40, "event": "Festivities", "description": "A celebration is called! Decide the nature of the event with the GM. Possibilities include a local wedding, a bountiful harvest, or a public execution! You are caught up in the event (and its aftermath) and lose an Endeavour." },
    { "min_roll": 41, "max_roll": 44, "event": "Inclement Weather", "description": "Particularly bad weather arrives. For the next adventure, all social Skill Tests suffer a penalty of –10 (everyone is in a foul mood) and food prices increase by 20% (due to spoiling of stored provender)." },
    { "min_roll": 45, "max_roll": 48, "event": "Glorious Weather", "description": "Beautiful conditions inspire you and give you cheer. You can add a new Short-term Ambition. When it's concluded, you do not replace it with a new one." },
    { "min_roll": 49, "max_roll": 52, "event": "Local Crop Failure", "description": "Food becomes exceedingly scarce and many folk suffer terribly. Characters from the Peasant class cannot undertake the Income Endeavour, and food prices are doubled in the area for the duration of the next adventure." },
    { "min_roll": 53, "max_roll": 56, "event": "Malicious Malady", "description": "The Bloody Flux sweeps through town. Make an Easy (+40) Toughness Test. On a success, the Flux passes by. On a failure, you and the Washers Guild are soon to know each other very well. Contract the Bloody Flux." },
    { "min_roll": 57, "max_roll": 60, "event": "Monstrous Complications", "description": "A monster (chosen by the GM from Chapter 12: Bestiary) is causing panic among the locals. The Income Endeavour provides no funds until the beast is dealt with. The characters can choose to each sacrifice one Endeavour to deal with the menace (and this encounter should be roleplayed). If you succeed, you gain a free Income Endeavour to represent their individual rewards, and a feast is held in their honour. If not, or if the party chooses to ignore the creature, it will move on or be killed by a local rival." },
    { "min_roll": 61, "max_roll": 63, "event": "Morr's Embrace", "description": "One of the character's relatives, friends, or allies dies. It could be of natural causes, an accident, or the beginning of something sinister..." },
    { "min_roll": 64, "max_roll": 65, "event": "New Moon", "description": "The nights are particularly dark. All Rogue characters undertaking the Income Endeavour receive a +20% bonus to their monies earned." },
    { "min_roll": 66, "max_roll": 67, "event": "Old Debts", "description": "You have a Major or Significant Favour called in. Dealing with the favour will be part of your next adventure and you lose one Endeavour in preparation for what is to come." },
    { "min_roll": 68, "max_roll": 69, "event": "Opportunity Saunters Through", "description": "Passing soldiers, well-heeled merchants, or vacationing nobles pass through the area, and characters willing to suck up reap the benefits. Burgher and Peasant Class characters gain +50% money from the Income Endeavour." },
    { "min_roll": 70, "max_roll": 71, "event": "Peace and Quiet", "description": "It's times like these that remind you what life is all about: good sleep and fine cheese. Be smugly content at the start of your next adventure." },
    { "min_roll": 72, "max_roll": 73, "event": "Pedlar", "description": "A wizened, well-travelled pedlar who likes a gossip passes through. For the price of a flagon of ale — 3d — you receive a +10 bonus to any Latest News Endeavours you attempt." },
    { "min_roll": 74, "max_roll": 76, "event": "Pestilential Pet", "description": "One of your animals falls ill; make a Challenging (+0) Animal Care Test. If successful, your beast pulls through. If not, the unfortunate creature dies. If you have no animals, you are troubled by ill omens of the GM's creation." },
    { "min_roll": 77, "max_roll": 79, "event": "Ransacked", "description": "Before you can undertake a Banking Endeavour, your stash is raided, and all your money is taken. If your money amounts to less than 1 GC, the thieves also steal your most highly-valued trapping." },
    { "min_roll": 80, "max_roll": 82, "event": "Riots", "description": "The common folk are furious at the high and mighty! Characters of the Courtier Class cannot take the Income Endeavour as, no matter how many bodyguards they hire, it isn't even vaguely safe for them to be abroad on business. Further, any deposits at reputable banks must immediately check to see if the violence and disruption has caused their bank to go out of business. However, players attempting a Foment Dissent Endeavour receive +10 bonus to all related Tests." },
    { "min_roll": 83, "max_roll": 85, "event": "Sticky Fingers", "description": "Your purse is cut! You lose half of the money you ended the last adventure with." },
    { "min_roll": 86, "max_roll": 88, "event": "Suspicion of Heresy", "description": "You fall foul of a Witch Hunter who suspects you have been consorting with Mutants, Cultists, or worse on your so-called 'adventures'. It takes a Very Hard (–30) Charm Test to convince the hunter you are innocent. Failure to do this means you have earned an implacable nemesis who is certain to cause trouble in the future..." },
    { "min_roll": 89, "max_roll": 91, "event": "Under Suspicion", "description": "The party's irregular movements and sudden wealth has drawn suspicion. All characters must forfeit one Endeavour laying low or proving their innocence. Characters in the Rogue class cannot use the Income Endeavour until after their next adventure." },
    { "min_roll": 92, "max_roll": 94, "event": "Uneventful", "description": "Little of interest occurs, perhaps leaving you with a boredom-inspired appetite for taking risks!" },
    { "min_roll": 95, "max_roll": 97, "event": "Unexpected Esteem", "description": "Someone you helped in the past has a chance to repay your efforts. The precise nature of the reward should be appropriate to your past deeds, and the NPCs you have assisted during play or in your back story. The tokens of gratitude may vary from a single high-quality item, to a purse of silver (which will be available at the start of the next adventure). Of course, all that glitters is not gold, and not all gifts are what they appear..." },
    { "min_roll": 98, "max_roll": 100, "event": "Unusual Mercenaries", "description": "One or more rare mercenaries turn up in a nearby settlement looking for work: a Tilean Duellist of great repute, the so-called Birdmen of Catrazza, unemployed Ogres under the command of a Halfling captain, or other unlikely bands. The mercenaries will gladly train any character in any martial Skills or Talents, at a 20% reduction in costs, should the characters undertake a Training or Unusual Learning Endeavour. Additionally, any characters undertaking a Combat Training Endeavour gain a +20 bonus to any relevant Test." }
  ]
}

{
  "combat_difficulty_table": [
    {
      "difficulty": "Very Easy",
      "modifier": 60,
      "examples": [
        "Shooting a Monstrous target (Giant size).",
        "Shooting into a crowd (13+ targets)."
      ]
    },
    {
      "difficulty": "Easy",
      "modifier": 40,
      "examples": [
        "Shooting a target at Point Blank Range.",
        "Shooting an Enormous target (Griffon size).",
        "Attacking an opponent you outnumber 3 to 1."
      ]
    },
    {
      "difficulty": "Average",
      "modifier": 20,
      "examples": [
        "Shooting at a Large group (7–12 targets).",
        "Shooting a Large target (Ogre size).",
        "Shooting at Short Range: less than half weapon range.",
        "Shooting at a small group (3–6 targets).",
        "Shooting when you spent your last Action aiming.",
        "Attacking an Engaged opponent in the sides or rear.",
        "Attacking an opponent you outnumber 2 to 1.",
        "Attacking a target with the 'Prone' Condition."
      ]
    },
    {
      "difficulty": "Challenging",
      "modifier": 0,
      "examples": [
        "A standard attack."
      ]
    },
    {
      "difficulty": "Difficult",
      "modifier": -10,
      "examples": [
        "Shooting an Average target (Human size).",
        "Attacking whilst you have the 'Prone' Condition, or otherwise beneath your target.",
        "Attacking whilst in the mud, heavy rain or difficult terrain.",
        "Shooting at Long Range: up to double weapon range.",
        "Shooting on a Round where you also use your Move.",
        "Shooting a small target (Child size).",
        "Target in soft cover (behind a hedge for example)."
      ]
    },
    {
      "difficulty": "Hard",
      "modifier": -20,
      "examples": [
        "A called shot to a specific Hit Location.",
        "Fighting in an enclosed space with a weapon with a Length longer than Average.",
        "Shooting targets concealed by fog, mist or shadow.",
        "Attacking in a monsoon, hurricane, thick blizzard, or other extreme weather.",
        "Dodging when you have the 'Prone' Condition, or are mounted.",
        "Close combat in darkness.",
        "Shooting a Little target (Cat size).",
        "Using a weapon in your off hand."
      ]
    },
    {
      "difficulty": "Very Hard",
      "modifier": -30,
      "examples": [
        "Target in medium cover (wooden fence for example).",
        "Attacking or dodging in the deep snow, water or other arduous terrain.",
        "Shooting a tiny target (Mouse size).",
        "Shooting at Extreme range, up to three times weapon range.",
        "Shooting in darkness.",
        "Target in hard cover (behind stone wall, for example)."
      ]
    }
  ]
}

36.comment: Reference: The Wrath of the Gods Table
36.content:
{
  "wrath_of_the_gods_table": [
    { "min_roll": 1, "max_roll": 5, "result": "Holy Visions: Visions of your god plague your senses. Attempt an Average (+20) Endurance Test. If you fail gain one Stunned Condition. The GM determines what the visions may be." },
    { "min_roll": 6, "max_roll": 10, "result": "Think Over Your Deeds: Any successful Pray test cannot achieve more than +0 SL for the next week." },
    { "min_roll": 11, "max_roll": 15, "result": "Heed My Lessons: You suffer a penalty of –10 to your Pray Skill for the next 1d10+Sin points Rounds." },
    { "min_roll": 16, "max_roll": 20, "result": "Prove Your Devotion: Gain the Prone Condition. This Condition is not removed until you score a Success with an Average (+20) Pray Test." },
    { "min_roll": 21, "max_roll": 25, "result": "You Try My Patience: You cannot enact any Pray Tests for 1d10 Rounds." },
    { "min_roll": 26, "max_roll": 30, "result": "You Do Not Understand My Intent: You suffer a penalty of –10 to any Skills associated with your deity (as determined by the GM) for the next 1d10+Sin points hours." },
    { "min_roll": 31, "max_roll": 35, "result": "I Find Your Lack Of Faith Disturbing: You cannot enact any Pray Tests for 1d10+Sin points Rounds." },
    { "min_roll": 36, "max_roll": 40, "result": "Share My Pain: You suffer 1+Sin points Wounds, ignoring Toughness Bonus and APs. Also attempt an Average (+20) Endurance Test. If you fail gain one Stunned Condition." },
    { "min_roll": 41, "max_roll": 45, "result": "Your Cause Is Unworthy: Your targets gain the Prone condition. Any Blessings or Miracles of your deity targeting them automatically fail for the next 1d10+Sin points days." },

37.comment: Reference: Map Scale - The Known World (Immortal Empires)
37.content:
### **`Reference: Map Scale - The Known World (Immortal Empires)`**

*   **1.0 Purpose:**
    *   To define and store the calibrated distance scale for the specific digital image file titled "Map of the Known World" (commonly associated with the Immortal Empires campaign, dated 2522 IC). This ensures consistent distance calculations across all sessions.

*   **2.0 Calibration Data:**
    *   **2.1 Source Document:** The scale is derived from the fan-compiled document: `Travel Distances in the Empire (and beyond) v1.0` by Jackdays.
    *   **2.2 Golden Standard:** The primary data point used for calibration is the road distance between Altdorf and Bögenhafen.
        *   **Reference Distance:** **90 miles**.
        *   **Rationale:** This route was chosen due to its consistent distance value (90 / 90 / 90) across all sources listed in the reference document, indicating high reliability.

*   **3.0 Stored Scale:**
    *   A `miles-per-pixel` ratio has been calculated based on the Golden Standard and the provided map image. This ratio is now the definitive scale for all subsequent measurements on this map.

*   **4.0 Methodology & Application:**
    *   **4.1 Measurement Type:** All calculations performed using this scale produce a direct, point-to-point, "as the crow flies" distance.
    *   **4.2 Interpretation:** This calculated distance does **not** represent the actual travel distance by road or river. Real-world routes are longer due to terrain, obstacles, and the winding nature of paths. The calculated number should be treated as a baseline estimate, with the final travel distance being longer.
    *   **4.3 Application in Travel:** When calculating travel time, this baseline distance must be adjusted to account for the mode of travel (road, river, sea, wilderness) as per the `Guideline: Travel & Encounters`.

---

40.content:
### **Game Systems Manifest**

This document outlines the structure and location of all rule modules provided in the JSON reference material.

#### **1.0 Character Creation & Advancement**
*All rules governing the creation, progression, and social standing of characters.*

*   **1.1 Species:** Core data for playable species (`human_reiklander`, `dwarf`, `halfling`, `high_elf`, `wood_elf`).
*   **1.2 Random Talents:** The `random_talents` table used for Human and Halfling creation.
*   **1.3 Careers:** The `careers_master` document, including the d100 table for determining starting careers.
*   **1.4 Starting Trappings:**
    *   `starting_equipment`: Defines equipment packages by Class.
    *   `starting_wealth`: Defines starting money by social Standing.
*   **1.5 Advancement:** The `advancement` document, detailing XP costs for improving skills, characteristics, and changing careers.
*   **1.6 Status & Social Interaction:**
    *   `status_effects`: Rules for how social Status modifies skill tests and NPC reactions.
    *   `income_table`: Rules for earning money during downtime based on Status.

#### **2.0 Core Mechanics**
*The fundamental engine of the game, governing actions, outcomes, and resources.*

*   **2.1 Testing & Outcomes:**
    *   `test_difficulty_table`: Core modifiers for all skill tests.
    *   `outcome_table`: Narrative descriptions for Success Levels (SL).
*   **2.2 Meta-Currencies:** The `meta_currency_uses` document, defining the rules for spending Fortune, Fate, Resolve, and Resilience.
*   **2.3 Psychology:** The `psychology` document, detailing rules for traits like Fear, Frenzy, and Hatred.
*   **2.4 Movement & Size:**
    *   `movement_rates`: Table converting the Movement characteristic to tactical speed.
    *   `size_table`: Combat modifiers based on creature size.

#### **3.0 Combat Systems**
*All rules and data related to combat encounters.*

*   **3.1 Combat Modifiers:**
    *   `combat_difficulty_table`: Situational modifiers for combat tests (e.g., range, cover, outnumbering).
    *   `advantage_rules`: Mechanics for the Advantage point system.
*   **3.2 Ranged & Melee:**
    *   `range_bands`: Modifiers for Point Blank, Short, Long, and Extreme range.
    *   `weapon_reach`: Defines engagement distances for melee weapons.
    *   `scatter_table`: Rules for missed area-of-effect or thrown attacks.
*   **3.3 Damage & Injury:**
    *   `hit_location_table`: Master table for determining hit location.
    *   **Critical Hit Tables:** Location-specific damage effects (`head`, `body`, `arm`, `leg`).
    *   `fumble_table`: Outcomes for critical failures in combat.

#### **4.0 Equipment, Economy & Services**
*Data for all items, wealth, and commerce.*

*   **4.1 Item Lists & Stats:**
    *   Melee Weapons (`hand_weapon`, `rapier`, etc.)
    *   Ranged Weapons (`blunderbuss`, `longbow`, etc.)
    *   Ammunition (`bullet_powder_12`, `arrow_12`, etc.)
    *   Armour (`leather_jack`, `mail_coat`, etc.)
*   **4.2 Item Properties:**
    *   Weapon `qualities` and `flaws` (`Accurate`, `Dangerous`, etc.).
    *   `armour_properties` (`Flexible`, `Impenetrable`, etc.).
*   **4.3 Economic Systems:**
    *   `availability_tests`: Rules for finding non-common items.
    *   `bartering_ratios`: Guidelines for trading items.
*   **4.4 Services:**
    *   `hireling_costs_table`: Costs for hiring various NPCs.

#### **5.0 Magic & Faith**
*All systems related to arcane and divine power.*

*   **5.1 Arcane Magic:**
    *   `lores`: Defines the eight Lores of Magic and their unique mechanical attributes.
    *   `overcasting_options`: Rules for empowering spells at a cost.
    *   `major_miscast` & `minor_miscast`: Rollable tables for when spellcasting goes wrong.
*   **5.2 Divine Power:**
    *   `Blessings of the Old World` & `Miracles of the Old World`: Full descriptions of divine powers.
    *   `Blessings by Cult` & `Miracles by Cult`: Quick reference tables for which deities grant which powers.
    *   `wrath_of_the_gods_table`: Divine punishments for angering a deity.

#### **6.0 Health & Afflictions**
*Systems detailing temporary and long-term negative effects on characters.*

*   **6.1 Conditions:** The `conditions` document, defining temporary status effects like `Bleeding`, `Stunned`, and `Fatigued`.
*   **6.2 Lasting Injuries:** The `lasting_injuries` document, with rules for `Broken Bones`, `Torn Muscles`, and `Amputations`.
*   **6.3 Disease:** The `diseases` document, including the list of specific illnesses and definitions for their symptoms.
*   **6.4 Corruption:**
    *   `corruption_data`: Mechanics for gaining Corruption Points.
    *   `physical_corruption_table` & `mental_corruption_table`: Rollable tables for mutations.
*   **6.5 Environmental Hazards:** The `environmental_hazards` document, with rules for drowning, exposure, and deprivation.

#### **7.0 Narrative & World Systems**
*Rules governing the story, downtime, and specific world data.*

*   **7.1 Downtime & Travel:**
    *   `events_table`: 100 rollable events for periods between adventures.
    *   **`travel_events_table`**: The newly added rollable table for events during journeys.
*   **7.2 World Data:**
    *   `Reference: Map Scale - The Known World (Immortal Empires)`: Defines the distance scale for the world map.

63.content:
### **`Reference: Blessings by Cult`**

*   **Purpose:** To provide a quick-reference table listing the six standard Blessings granted to the followers of each primary Imperial cult.

---
> A character with the **Bless** Talent automatically receives all six Blessings associated with their cult as listed below. The specific effects of each Blessing are detailed in the `Reference: Blessings of the Old World` document.

| Cult | Blessing 1 | Blessing 2 | Blessing 3 | Blessing 4 | Blessing 5 | Blessing 6 |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **Manann** | Battle | Breath | Courage | Hardiness | Savagery | Tenacity |
| **Morr** | Breath | Courage | Fortune | Righteousness | Tenacity | Wisdom |
| **Myrmidia** | Battle | Conscience | Courage | Fortune | Protection | Righteousness |
| **Ranald** | Charisma | Conscience | Finesse | Fortune | Protection | Wit |
| **Rhya** | Breath | Conscience | Grace | Healing | Protection | Recuperation |
| **Shallya** | Breath | Conscience | Healing | Protection | Recuperation | Tenacity |
| **Sigmar** | Battle | Courage | Hardiness | Might | Protection | Righteousness |
| **Taal** | Battle | Breath | Conscience | Hardiness | The Hunt | Savagery |
| **Ulric** | Battle | Courage | Hardiness | Might | Savagery | Tenacity |
| **Verena** | Conscience | Courage | Fortune | Righteousness | Wisdom | Wit |

---

64.content:
### **`Reference: Miracles by Cult`**

*   **Purpose:** To provide a quick-reference table listing the standard Miracles granted to the followers of each primary Imperial cult.

---
> A character with the **Invoke** Talent can learn and use the Miracles associated with their cult as listed below. The specific effects of each Miracle are detailed in the `Reference: Miracles of the Old World` document.

| Cult | Miracle 1 | Miracle 2 | Miracle 3 | Miracle 4 | Miracle 5 | Miracle 6 |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **Manann** | Becalm | Drowned Man's Face | Fair Winds | Manann's Bounty | Sea Legs | Waterwalk |
| **Morr** | Death Mask | Destroy Undead | Dooming | Last Rites | Portal's Threshold | Stay Morr's Hand |
| **Myrmidia** | Blazing Sun | Eagle's Eye | Fury's Call | Inspiring | Shield of Myrmidia | Spear of Myrmidia |
| **Ranald** | An Invitation | Cat's Eyes | Ranald's Grace | Rich Man, Poor Man... | Stay Lucky | You Ain't Seen Me, Right? |
| **Rhya** | Rhya's Children | Rhya's Harvest | Rhya's Shelter | Rhya's Succour | Rhya's Touch | Rhya's Union |
| **Shallya** | Anchorite's Endurance | Balm to a Wounded Mind | Bitter Catharsis | Martyr | Shallya's Tears | Unblemished Innocence |
| **Sigmar** | Beacon of Righteous Virtue | Heed Not the Witch | Sigmar's Fiery Hammer | Soulfire | Twin-tailed Comet | Vanquish the Unrighteous |
| **Taal** | Animal Instincts | King of the Wild | Leaping Stag | Lord of the Hunt | Tanglefoot | Tooth and Claw |
| **Ulric** | Hoarfrost's Chill | Howl of the Wolf | Pelt of the Winter Wolf | The Snow King's Judgement | Ulric's Fury | Winter's Bite |
| **Verena** | As Verena Is My Witness | Blind Justice | Shackles of Truth | Sword of Justice | Truth Will Out | Wisdom of the Owl |

---

65.comment: Reference: Blessings of the Old World
65.content:
### **`Reference: Blessings of the Old World`**

*   **Purpose:** To provide a comprehensive list and detailed descriptions of all common Blessings available to the faithful.

---

**Blessing of Battle**
> *   **Range:** 6 meters
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** 6 rounds
> *   **Description:** Your target gains +10 to their Weapon Skill (WS).

**Blessing of Breath**
> *   **Range:** 6 meters
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** 6 rounds
> *   **Description:** Your target does not need to breathe and ignores all rules for suffocation.

**Blessing of Charisma**
> *   **Range:** 6 meters
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** 6 rounds
> *   **Description:** Your target gains +10 to their Fellowship (Fel).

**Blessing of Conscience**
> *   **Range:** 6 meters
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** 6 rounds
> *   **Description:** Your target must pass an **Average (+20) Willpower Test** to break any of the Strictures of your deity. If they fail, they are overcome with shame and do not take the action.

**Blessing of Courage**
> *   **Range:** 6 meters
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** 6 rounds
> *   **Description:** Your target gains +10 to their Willpower (WP).

**Blessing of Finesse**
> *   **Range:** 6 meters
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** 6 rounds
> *   **Description:** Your target gains +10 to their Dexterity (Dex).

**Blessing of Fortune**
> *   **Range:** 6 meters
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** 6 rounds
> *   **Description:** Your target’s next failed test may be rerolled. The result of the reroll must stand.

**Blessing of Grace**
> *   **Range:** 6 meters
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** 6 rounds
> *   **Description:** Your target gains +10 to their Agility (Ag).

**Blessing of Hardiness**
> *   **Range:** 6 meters
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** 6 rounds
> *   **Description:** Your target gains +10 to their Toughness (T).

**Blessing of Healing**
> *   **Range:** Touch
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** Instant
> *   **Description:** Your target heals +1 Wound.

**Blessing of Might**
> *   **Range:** 6 meters
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** 6 rounds
> *   **Description:** Your target gains +10 to their Strength (S).

**Blessing of Protection**
> *   **Range:** 6 meters
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** 6 rounds
> *   **Description:** Enemies must make an **Average (+20) Willpower Test** to attack your target. If they fail, they are overcome with shame and must choose a different target or a different Action.

**Blessing of Recuperation**
> *   **Range:** Touch
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** Instant
> *   **Description:** Your target may reduce the duration of one disease they are afflicted with by 1 day. This prayer may only be attempted once per instance of a disease per person.

**Blessing of Righteousness**
> *   **Range:** 6 meters
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** 6 rounds
> *   **Description:** Your target’s weapon counts as Magical for the duration.

**Blessing of Savagery**
> *   **Range:** 6 meters
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** 6 rounds
> *   **Description:** When your target next inflicts a Critical Wound, they may roll twice on the appropriate Critical Wound table and choose the result they prefer.

**Blessing of Tenacity**
> *   **Range:** 6 meters
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** Instant
> *   **Description:** Your target may remove 1 Condition.

**Blessing of The Hunt**
> *   **Range:** 6 meters
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** 6 rounds
> *   **Description:** Your target gains +10 to their Ballistic Skill (BS).

**Blessing of Wisdom**
> *   **Range:** 6 meters
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** 6 rounds
> *   **Description:** Your target gains +10 to their Intelligence (Int).

**Blessing of Wit**
> *   **Range:** 6 meters
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** 6 rounds
> *   **Description:** Your target gains +10 to their Initiative (I).

---

66.comment: Reference: Miracles of the Old World
66.content:
### **`Reference: Miracles of the Old World`**

*   **Purpose:** To provide a comprehensive list and detailed descriptions of all common Miracles available to the faithful.

---

**An Invitation**
> *   **Range:** 1 meter
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** Instant
> *   **Description:** A door, window, or hatch you target has one method of securing it undone (a lock unlocks, a latch unlatches, etc.).
> *   **Enhancement:** For every +2 SL, you may target another method of securing the same portal.

**Anchorite’s Endurance**
> *   **Range:** Fellowship meters
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** The target feels no pain and suffers no penalties caused by Conditions for the duration.

**Animal Instincts**
> *   **Range:** Touch
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Hours
> *   **Description:** The target gains the **Acute Sense (Choose One)** Talent. If they rest, they will automatically awaken should any threats come within Initiative meters.

**As Verena Is My Witness**
> *   **Range:** You
> *   **Target:** You
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** For the duration, providing you speak only the truth, all listeners will believe your words are true. This does not compel them to agree with your conclusions.

**Balm to a Wounded Mind**
> *   **Range:** Touch
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Minutes
> *   **Description:** All Psychology traits are removed from the target for the duration. Afterwards, the target enters a deep and restful slumber until the next sunrise, unless disturbed. An unwilling target may make a **Challenging (+0) Cool Test** to resist sleeping.

**Beacon of Righteous Virtue**
> *   **Range:** You
> *   **Target:** Area of Effect
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** You become infused with holy fire. All allies with Line of Sight to you instantly remove all **Broken** Conditions and gain the **Fearless** Talent for the duration. Any Greenskins with Line of Sight to you are subject to **Fear (1)**.

**Becalm**
> *   **Range:** Initiative Bonus Kilometers
> *   **Target:** 1 sailing vessel within Line of Sight
> *   **Duration:** 1 Hour
> *   **Description:** You steal the wind from the sails of a ship. It is completely becalmed. An area of eerie calm and smooth waters extends for Initiative meters from the vessel, travelling with it even if propelled by other means.

**Bitter Catharsis**
> *   **Range:** Touch
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** Instant
> *   **Description:** You draw a poison or disease from your target into yourself, completely purging it from their system. For each poison or disease removed, you suffer Wounds equal to 1d10 – your Fellowship Bonus (ignoring TB and AP).
> *   **Enhancement:** For every +2 SL, you may purge another disease or poison from the same target.

**Blazing Sun**
> *   **Range:** You
> *   **Target:** Area of Effect
> *   **Duration:** Instant
> *   **Description:** A blinding flash of golden light bursts forth. All non-Myrmidians looking in your direction receive 1 **Blinded** Condition.
> *   **Enhancement:** For every +2 SL, they receive an additional **Blinded** Condition.

**Blind Justice**
> *   **Range:** You
> *   **Target:** You
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** You can make a **Simple Challenging (+0) Perception Test** to see through illusionary spells and miracles. You may also make an **Average (+20) Intuition Test** to determine if a character speaking to you believes they are telling the truth.

**Cat’s Eyes**
> *   **Range:** Fellowship meters
> *   **Target:** You
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** A spectral cat manifests, which you can see through and control. It cannot be harmed. While using the cat's senses, you are blind and deaf to your own surroundings.

**Death Mask**
> *   **Range:** You
> *   **Target:** You
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** Your visage takes on a cadaverous mien, and you gain the **Fear (1)** Trait.

**Destroy Undead**
> *   **Range:** You
> *   **Target:** Area of Effect
> *   **Duration:** Instant
> *   **Description:** A black fire ripples from your body in a circle with a radius of Fellowship Bonus meters. All targets with the **Undead** Trait lose 1d10 Wounds, ignoring Toughness Bonus and AP. Undead destroyed this way cannot be raised again by normal necromancy.
> *   **Enhancement:** For every +2 SL, you may increase the area of effect by +Fellowship Bonus meters.

**Dooming**
> *   **Range:** Touch
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** Instant
> *   **Description:** You are granted a vision of the target’s Doom, almost always related to their death. This Miracle may only be performed on a character once. Afterwards, the target may purchase the **Doomed** Talent as if it were in their Career.

**Drowned Man’s Face**
> *   **Range:** Fellowship meters
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** Your target's lungs continuously fill with saltwater. They gain a **Fatigued** Condition and are subject to the rules for Drowning and Suffocation for the duration. When the Miracle ends, the target must pass a **Challenging (+0) Endurance Test** or gain a **Prone** Condition.

**Eagle’s Eye**
> *   **Range:** Fellowship meters
> *   **Target:** You
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** A spectral eagle manifests, which you can see through and control to survey the battlefield. It cannot be harmed. While using the eagle's senses, you are blind and deaf to your own surroundings.

**Fair Winds**
> *   **Range:** Initiative Bonus Kilometers
> *   **Target:** 1 sailing vessel within Line of Sight
> *   **Duration:** 1 Hour
> *   **Description:** The target vessel's sails fill with favourable winds, moving it at top speed regardless of prevailing conditions. All Tests to steer the vessel gain a +10 bonus.

**Fury’s Call**
> *   **Range:** Fellowship meters
> *   **Target:** Intelligence Bonus allies
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** All affected allies receive the **Hatred** Psychology towards any enemy engaging them in combat.

**Heed Not the Witch**
> *   **Range:** You
> *   **Target:** Area of Effect
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** Any spells targeting anyone or anything within Fellowship Bonus meters of you suffer a –20 penalty to the Language (Magick) Test.
> *   **Enhancement:** For every +2 SL, you may increase the area of effect by your Fellowship Bonus in meters.

**Hoarfrost’s Chill**
> *   **Range:** You
> *   **Target:** Area of Effect
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** The air around you grows unnaturally cold. You cause **Fear (1)** in all enemies. All creatures within your Fellowship Bonus in meters lose –1 Advantage at the start of each Round.

**Howl of the Wolf**
> *   **Range:** Fellowship meters
> *   **Target:** Special
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** You summon a Divine Servant in the form of a White Wolf. It has the statistics of a Wolf but gains the **Frenzy**, **Magical**, and **Size (Large)** Traits. It fights your enemies for the duration before vanishing.

**Inspiring**
> *   **Range:** Fellowship meters
> *   **Target:** Intelligence Bonus allies
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** Affected targets gain the **Drilled (+1)** Talent.

**King of the Wild**
> *   **Range:** Fellowship meters
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** Taal sends a wild animal appropriate for the area, which will act according to your wishes for the duration.

**Last Rites**
> *   **Range:** 1 meter
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** Instant
> *   **Description:** You chant a solemn requiem over a corpse, ensuring its soul passes to Morr's realm and making it immune to Necromantic spells. If the target has both the **Undead** and **Construct** Traits, it is destroyed.

**Leaping Stag**
> *   **Range:** You
> *   **Target:** You
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** You gain +1 Movement and the **Strong Legs (+1)** Talent. You automatically pass all Athletics Tests to jump with at least +0 SL.

**Lord of the Hunt**
> *   **Range:** You
> *   **Target:** You
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Hours
> *   **Description:** You call on Taal to guide you in the hunt for a specific animal you have seen or an individual you know. You cannot lose the quarry’s trail (unless by supernatural means) and gain a +10 bonus to all Tests regarding your quarry for the duration. The trail ends if the quarry enters a settlement.

**Manann’s Bounty**
> *   **Range:** Touch
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** Instant
> *   **Description:** Reaching into a body of water, you catch enough fish to feed 1 person (or 2 people if it is the sea).
> *   **Enhancement:** For every +2 SL, you may feed one additional person.

**Martyr**
> *   **Range:** Fellowship meters
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** Any Damage taken by your target is instead suffered by you. When calculating Wounds you suffer from this effect, your Toughness Bonus is doubled.

**Pelt of the Winter Wolf**
> *   **Range:** Touch
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Hours
> *   **Description:** The target still feels the discomfort of cold and wintry weather but suffers no mechanical penalties from it.

**Portal’s Threshold**
> *   **Range:** Touch
> *   **Target:** Area of Effect
> *   **Duration:** Until dawn
> *   **Description:** You draw a line up to 8 meters long on the ground. Creatures with the **Undead** Trait must pass a **Challenging (+0) Willpower Test** to cross it. Creatures with both **Undead** and **Construct** Traits cannot cross it at all.

**Ranald’s Grace**
> *   **Range:** Touch
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** Agility Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** Your target gains +10 Agility, +10 Stealth, and the **Catfall (+1)** Talent for the duration.

**Rhya’s Children**
> *   **Range:** You
> *   **Target:** Area of Effect
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** May only be invoked outdoors, outside settlements. You sense the presence and passing of all sentient creatures within a radius of Fellowship meters.
> *   **Enhancement:** Each +2 SL extends the area of effect by an additional +Fellowship meters.

**Rhya’s Harvest**
> *   **Range:** Touch
> *   **Target:** You
> *   **Duration:** 1 Round
> *   **Description:** Edible fruit, vegetables, and fungi grow at the point you touch. Each round the Miracle is in effect, you cause enough food to grow to feed 1 person.

**Rhya’s Shelter**
> *   **Range:** You
> *   **Target:** You
> *   **Duration:** Special
> *   **Description:** May only be invoked outdoors, outside settlements. You discover a perfect natural shelter, protected from wind and rain, large enough for 1 person. It lasts as long as you are camped there.
> *   **Enhancement:** For every +2 SL, the shelter can fit one additional individual.

**Rhya’s Succour**
> *   **Range:** Fellowship meters
> *   **Target:** Fellowship Bonus allies
> *   **Duration:** Instant
> *   **Description:** All affected targets have 1 Condition removed. If this removes all of a target's Conditions, they feel refreshed and gain +10 to all tests on their next Turn.

**Rhya’s Touch**
> *   **Range:** Touch
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** Special (10+ minutes)
> *   **Description:** You lay hands on an injured or diseased target. Choose one effect: Heal Fellowship Bonus Wounds OR Cure 1 naturally occurring disease. The Miracle takes at least 10 minutes to manifest and is interrupted if you are disturbed.
> *   **Enhancement:** For every +2 SL, you may choose another effect, and may choose the same effect repeatedly.

**Rhya’s Union**
> *   **Range:** Touch
> *   **Target:** Special (a couple)
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Hours
> *   **Description:** You bless the union between two souls. If biologically possible, the couple will conceive a child while the Miracle is in effect.

**Rich Man, Poor Man, Beggar Man, Thief**
> *   **Range:** 1 meter
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Minutes
> *   **Description:** For each target affected, choose one illusion: their purse appears empty; their purse appears full; their attire appears cheap; their attire appears rich; a single valuable item is impossible to perceive.
> *   **Enhancement:** For every +2 SL, you may select an additional effect for one of your targets.

**Sea Legs**
> *   **Range:** Fellowship meters
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** Your target is drenched in spectral saltwater and reels as if on a storm-tossed ship. They gain one each of the **Blinded**, **Deafened**, and **Fatigued** Conditions, and must pass an **Average (+20) Agility Test** to use their Move or gain a **Prone** Condition.

**Shackles of Truth**
> *   **Range:** Fellowship meters
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** If your target has committed a crime and lies about it while under this effect, they gain an **Entangled** Condition that cannot be removed for the duration. If you have falsely accused the target, you gain +1 Sin point and must immediately roll on The Wrath of the Gods table.

**Shallya’s Tears**
> *   **Range:** Touch
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** Special (10 – FB Rounds)
> *   **Description:** After praying for a number of rounds equal to 10 – your Fellowship Bonus, you heal the target of 1 Critical Wound. This Miracle cannot reattach amputated parts. If your prayer is interrupted, the Miracle fails.
> *   **Enhancement:** For every +2 SL, you may heal another Critical Wound.

**Shield of Myrmidia**
> *   **Range:** Fellowship meters
> *   **Target:** Intelligence Bonus allies
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** All affected targets gain +1 Armour Point on all locations.

**Sigmar’s Fiery Hammer**
> *   **Range:** You
> *   **Target:** You
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** If you are wielding a warhammer, it counts as Magical, deals +Fellowship Bonus Damage, and any target struck receives the **Ablaze** and **Prone** Conditions.

**Soulfire**
> *   **Range:** You
> *   **Target:** Area of Effect
> *   **Duration:** Instant
> *   **Description:** Holy fire explodes from your body in a radius of Fellowship Bonus meters. All targets take 1d10 Wounds, ignoring TB and AP. Targets with the **Undead** or **Daemon** Traits also gain the **Ablaze** Condition.
> *   **Enhancement:** For every +2 SL, you may choose to either increase the area of effect by +Fellowship Bonus meters OR cause an extra +2 Damage to any Greenskins, Undead, or servants of Chaos affected.

**Spear of Myrmidia**
> *   **Range:** You
> *   **Target:** You
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** If you are wielding a spear, it gains the **Impact** Quality and counts as Magical for the duration.

**Stay Lucky**
> *   **Range:** You
> *   **Target:** You
> *   **Duration:** Special
> *   **Description:** You gain +1 Fortune point. You may not invoke this Miracle again until you have 0 Fortune points.
> *   **Enhancement:** For every +2 SL, you may gain an extra +1 Fortune point, which may take you beyond your normal maximum.

**Stay Morr’s Hand**
> *   **Range:** Touch
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Hours (Special)
> *   **Description:** You touch a willing target with 0 Wounds. For the duration, the target gains the **Unconscious** Condition and will not deteriorate further from disease, poison, or Critical Wounds. The miracle ends if they are healed or if you perform the last rites, allowing their soul to pass peacefully.

**Sword of Justice**
> *   **Range:** You
> *   **Target:** You
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** If you are wielding a sword, it ignores AP and counts as Magical. If a struck opponent is a criminal (GM's discretion), they must pass an **Average (+20) Endurance Test** or gain an **Unconscious** Condition for at least Fellowship Bonus Rounds. If any crime is perpetrated on the unconscious opponent, you gain +1 Sin point per crime.

**Tanglefoot**
> *   **Range:** Fellowship meters
> *   **Target:** Area of Effect
> *   **Duration:** Instant
> *   **Description:** Roots and vines erupt from the ground. All targets within Fellowship Bonus meters of the target point gain an **Entangled** Condition. Tanglefoot has a Strength equal to your Willpower for the purposes of breaking free.
> *   **Enhancement:** For every +2 SL, you may either increase the area of effect by +Fellowship Bonus meters OR inflict an extra **Entangled** Condition.

**The Snow King’s Judgement**
> *   **Range:** Fellowship meters
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** Instant
> *   **Description:** The target suffers 1d10 Wounds, ignoring TB and AP. If the GM rules that the target is not weak, cowardly, or deceitful, you suffer the effects instead.

**Tooth and Claw**
> *   **Range:** You
> *   **Target:** You
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** You gain the **Bite (SB+3)** and **Weapon (SB+4)** Creature Traits. These attacks are Magical.

**Truth Will Out**
> *   **Range:** Fellowship Bonus meters
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** Instant
> *   **Description:** You may ask the target a single question, which they must answer truthfully and fully. The target may resist by making an **Opposed Cool Test** against your successful Pray Test's SL. If they win, they can refuse to answer. If they win by +2 SL, they can withhold minor information; by +4 SL, significant information; by +6 SL, they can lie outright. You will know if they resist successfully.

**Twin-tailed Comet**
> *   **Range:** Fellowship meters
> *   **Target:** Area of Effect
> *   **Duration:** Instant
> *   **Description:** A twin-tailed comet strikes a point you can see within range. Everything within Fellowship Bonus meters of the impact suffers 1d10 + SL Damage (ignoring TB and AP) and gains the **Ablaze** Condition. The target location must be outdoors and an enemy of Sigmar.

**Ulric’s Fury**
> *   **Range:** Fellowship meters
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** The target gains the **Frenzy** Psychology.

**Unblemished Innocence**
> *   **Range:** Touch
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** Instant
> *   **Description:** Must be enacted within one hour of the target gaining a Corruption point. The target loses 1 Corruption point. If you Fumble this prayer, you and the target both gain 1d10 Corruption points.
> *   **Enhancement:** The target loses an additional Corruption point for every +2 SL.

**Vanquish the Unrighteous**
> *   **Range:** Fellowship meters
> *   **Target:** Fellowship Bonus allies
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** All affected allies receive the **Hatred** Psychology towards Greenskins, Undead, and any beings associated with Chaos.

**Waterwalk**
> *   **Range:** You
> *   **Target:** You
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus minutes
> *   **Description:** You can walk across a large body of water (at least 10 meters wide) as if it were solid ground.

**Winter’s Bite**
> *   **Range:** You
> *   **Target:** You
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** If you are wielding an axe, it counts as Magical and deals an additional +SL Damage. Any living target struck must pass a **Challenging (+0) Endurance Test** or gain a **Stunned** Condition. Struck targets lose any **Bleeding** Conditions as their blood freezes; attacks from this axe cannot cause new **Bleeding** Conditions.

**Wisdom of the Owl**
> *   **Range:** You
> *   **Target:** You
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** You gain a +20 bonus on all Intelligence Tests. Your pupils dilate, granting you the **Menacing (+1)** and **Acute Sense (Sight)** Talents for the duration.

**You Ain’t Seen Me, Right?**
> *   **Range:** Fellowship meters
> *   **Target:** 1
> *   **Duration:** Fellowship Bonus Rounds
> *   **Description:** May only be invoked if no one is looking directly at you. The target may pass unnoticed, providing they do nothing to draw attention to themselves (attacking, speaking, making loud noises, etc.).
